# Section V. Random variation (placeholder for summary)

We're saving this for last because, with lots of data, it's not clear what to make of it. Proper modeling comes first.

## Fallacy: QWERTY and p-values

QWERTY was invented to reduce stuck keys.

p-values were invented for the context of

- Benchtop experiments involving randomization (so, no confounding)
- Not so many scientists, so no Garden of Forking Paths, file-drawer bias, data mining
- Not designed to be a threshold for publication acceptance
- Other frameworks now feasible, e.g. Bayes
